declarations.comments: Application policy is such that the inputs are stored in the named handler's "pending" values, if a handler isn't registered.
declarations.title: putMany

declarations.comments: Application policy is such that the inputs will be applied uniformly to all handlers, sorted by their keyed ordering, per input - directed by `t`'s `Traversable` instance.
declarations.title: broadcastManyExcept

declarations.comments: Application policy is such that the globally pending inputs will be extracted and applied to the handler, if they exist, and likewise to the locally pending inputs,
declarations.title: on

declarations.comments: Removes only the globally pending inputs
declarations.title: takeBroadcast

declarations.comments: Removes locally pending inputs for a specific key
declarations.title: take

declarations.comments: Unregisters a handler, returns whether one existed
declarations.title: del

declarations.comments: Removes all handlers, but preserves pending data
declarations.title: clear

declarations.comments: Applies a nullary named handler, to remove any globally pending data
declarations.title: drain

declarations.comments: Invoke the queue in `Aff`
declarations.title: callAsync

declarations.comments: Invoke the queue in `Eff`
declarations.title: callAsyncEff

declarations.comments: For binding the receiver
declarations.title: registerSync

declarations.comments: Bind a receiver only once
declarations.title: registerSyncOnce

declarations.comments: Treat this as the only handler, and on the next input, clear all handlers.
declarations.title: once

declarations.comments: Removes the registered callbacks, if any.
declarations.title: del

declarations.comments: Adds a listener that does nothing, and "drains" any pending messages.
declarations.title: drain

declarations.comments: Invoke the queue in `Aff`
declarations.title: callAsync

declarations.comments: Invoke the queue in `Eff`
declarations.title: callAsyncEff

declarations.comments: For binding the receiver
declarations.title: registerSync

declarations.comments: Bind a receiver only once
declarations.title: registerSyncOnce

declarations.comments: Treat this as the only handler, and on the next input, clear all handlers.
declarations.title: once

declarations.comments: Removes the registered callbacks, if any.
declarations.title: del

declarations.comments: Invoke the queue in `Aff`
declarations.title: callAsync

declarations.comments: Invoke the queue in `Eff`
declarations.title: callAsyncEff

declarations.comments: For binding the receiver
declarations.title: registerSync

declarations.comments: Bind a receiver only once
declarations.title: registerSyncOnce
